intro: Lippia strobiliformis var. parvifolia, commonly known as the Mexican blue sage, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a compact, shrub-like growth habit and is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and fragrant properties. The leaves are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some cuisines.
